title: 111_hr1719
content: The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009, also known as the National Voter Registration Act of 1993, requires the availability of internet registration for voters. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 mandates that each State must provide online voter registration services on their official website, including access to registration forms, assistance in completing forms, online submission, and acceptance of completed forms. Services must be provided in a nonpartisan manner. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 requires States to offer online voter registration services on their official websites in a nonpartisan manner. The Act prohibits influencing political preference, displaying party allegiance, or discouraging voter registration. States must also implement security measures to protect user information. The requirements apply to Federal elections starting in 2016. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 mandates online voter registration through official websites, ensuring nonpartisan services. The Act specifies timing for online registration, requiring submission at least 15 days before the election. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 mandates online voter registration through official websites, with a requirement to submit at least 15 days before the election. Section 8(a)(5) of the Act is amended to include penalties for noncompliance. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 now allows the use of the internet to update registration information. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 permits registered voters to update their information, including address and email, online through the official election website. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 allows registered voters to update their information online or in person, with election officials required to update the voter's information on the computerized list and confirm updates via email to prevent fraud. The Voter Registration Modernization Act of 2009 mandates State or local election officials to implement technological security measures to prevent unauthorized changes to a voter's registration information and entry of fraudulent data, effective January 1, 2012. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 regarding the effective date. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to allow updating voter information online and prohibits removal of registered voters for failure to vote. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to include provisions for registrants without a unique identifier in the statewide voter registration list. A conforming amendment is made regarding procedures for voting after failing to notify a change of address. These amendments will be effective from January 1, 2012. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to include provisions for registrants without a unique identifier in the statewide voter registration list. A new section is added for the provision of election information by electronic mail to individuals registered to vote. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to include a space on the voter registration form for an email address. Applicants will receive voter registration and voting information through electronic mail unless they request otherwise. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to require election officials to provide registered voters with voter registration and voting information via email if an email address is provided. This information must be sent at least 7 days before the election date. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 now requires election officials to email registered voters important voting information at least 7 days before the election, including polling place details, hours of operation, and any required identification. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 clarifies that states must register applicants who provide necessary information to show eligibility to vote in federal elections. SEC. 6. Availability of requirements payments under HAVA to cover costs of compliance with new NVRA requirements. Section 251(b) of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to allow states to use requirements payments for voter registration activities under the National Voter Registration Act of 1993. This amendment also includes a conforming amendment to Section 254(a)(1) of the Act. The effective date of these amendments is specified. The amendments made by section 251(b)(3) shall apply from fiscal year 2010 onwards.
